definition: emperor/emperor of Japan
day/sky/heaven
emperor/old variant of 惶[huang2]
surname Huang
Emperor of Japan

sentences.english: At last, the emperor of Japan announced capitulation.
sentences.chinese: 终于，日本天皇宣布投降。

sentences.english: Kitano musashi narrates the sea, how to lose how encounter tikal emperor god crossbow.
sentences.chinese: 北野武藏叙说海上如何遭遇劲敌，如何失去天皇神弩。

sentences.english: Although the Mikado have scruple, but did not oppose it.
sentences.chinese: 天皇对此虽有顾虑，但并没有表示反对。

sentences.english: Japan’s emperor Hirohito tragically vacillated over the war.
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇裕仁对战争的优柔寡断是悲剧性的。

sentences.english: Japan'semperor wants to retire. Is he allowed to?
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇想要退位，他是否有权这样做？

sentences.english: Wen first conveyed President Hu Jintao’s greetings to Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝首先转达了胡锦涛主席对天皇明仁的问候。

sentences.english: Hu extends condolences to Japanese emperor.
sentences.chinese: 胡锦涛致电日本天皇表示慰问。

sentences.english: On August 10, they prevailed, and the Emperor of Japan surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 8月10日，他们成功了，日本天皇投降了。

sentences.english: Jiangchuan for the failure of shame, she is going to cut abdomen to the emperor to malaysians.
sentences.chinese: 江川为这次的失败羞愧难当，她准备切腹向天皇谢罪。

sentences.english: To Kiyota and thousands like him, Emperor Akihito expressed his admiration.
sentences.chinese: 为了清田和他一样数千明仁天皇对此表示钦佩。

sentences.english: The power of Mikado in Japan is symbolic .
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇的权利是象征性的。

sentences.english: The closer you get to the emperor, the fuzzier everything gets.
sentences.chinese: 你追本溯源，越是接近天皇，事情就越是变得模糊。

sentences.english: A. Graciously I have received Meiji Emperor's last injunctions.
sentences.chinese: 亲切地我已经收到明治天皇皇帝的最后指示。

sentences.english: Keenan (English Version): You've already told the court that the emperor loves peace, didn't you?
sentences.chinese: 那么你已经对法庭说过日本天皇爱和平，是吗？

sentences.english: Earlier Wednesday, Hu met Japanese Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 7日上午，胡锦涛会见了日本天皇。

sentences.english: Eg: The power of Mikado in Japan is symbolic .
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇的权利是象征性的。

definition: Emperor of Japan
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
ASHIKAGA Yoshimitsu (1358-1408), third Ashikaga shogun, reigned 1368-1394
Prince Shōtoku Taiji (574-621), major Japanese statesman and reformer of the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代[Fei1 niao3 Shi2 dai4], proponent of state Buddhism, portrayed as Buddhist saint
TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi (1536-1598), Japanese warlord, undisputed ruler of Japan 1590-1598
to abdicate
to inform/to notify
Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
Akihito, personal name of the Heisei 平成[Ping2 cheng2] emperor of Japan (1933-), reigned 1989-2019
Tojo Hideki (1884-1948), Japanese military leader hanged as war criminal in 1948
crown prince
prime minister (of Japan or UK etc)
Kamakura bakufu 1192-1333, the first Japanese samurai shogunate
Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
formal title of the Japanese prime minister
pinyin: Nei4 ge2 Zong3 li3 Da4 chen2

definition: Muromachi bakufu, the feudal government of Japan (1338-1573) under the Ashikaga shoguns
